m2mimud.game
Class PlayerCache

java.lang.Object
  m2mimud.game.PlayerCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class PlayerCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

The player cache contains a listing of all the player characters that are currently present in the game as well the unihandle to the game unit which controls. It's primary function is to inform its listener that a player has timed out, which means that no explicit action has been taken by that unit for 10 minutes. (Notes: SessionAd broadcasts do cause a player's timer to be reset.

See Also:

performLookup

public void performLookup(java.lang.String name,
                          java.util.Vector lookupVector)
Performs a lookup on the given name. This takes all the ids of the characters with the given name and places them into the vector. Note that the vector is cleared before any prcessing is done.

Parameters:
name - The name to perform the lookup on
lookupVector - The vector to store the results in
